ratings.comment: Grading for this course is not clear and often it appears they look for reasons to take points off. Was told by my TA that you are almost guaranteed a B because A's are very hard. Janet is nice enough, but she grades harshly and often by rubrics designed to trip you up. Plus, she'll be vague until after she's graded.

I heard before I started Biocore that final grades are not based on your work but rather grades that they think you deserve. While she is sweet, she relies solely on TA graded work and allows them to determine final grades. If you care about your GPA do not take Biocore. You don't have control over the final grade you receive.
Janet is the sweetest creature you will ever meet. She is always willing to help and forms genuine bonds with her students. Amazing teacher.

Janet is one of the best professors I could've asked for in a lab course. Inquiry/exploration-based learning is a big focus of the Biocore labs which I think is great because it prepares you for real research labs. I honestly never thought her feedback was vague, but it does require a lot of thinking, reasoning, and work on your part.

Professor Batzli clearly loves to work with students and help teach them to think like scientists. She is very kind and accessible and pretty much runs a large part of the Biocore lab program. However, sometimes it seemed like her explanations were a little convoluted and difficult to understand. But overall, she is a great person and teacher.

Janet is central to the Biocore program. A lot of students really liked her, but honestly, I didn't think she was a fantastic teacher. She wasn't a bad teacher by any means, but she was extremely confusing, and ended up making things harder to understand because she tried to be as vague as possible so "you could find the answer yourself".

Try to get on her good side. Make it seem as if you are actually interested in the material. Good luck finding time to study for your other classes, this class takes up all of your time. Make sure Biocore is something you actually want to do because it's a huge commitment.

Janet is basically the nicest, most helpful person you will ever meet.  With that being said, this class is extremely time consuming. I don't quite think the instructors realize how long some of the assignmentsprojects take to do, especially when trying to meet the high expectations they give us. Although, the lab is well taught and very useful.
Very friendly and passionate in her material. However, she is very bad at presenting, and doesn't answer questions in any reasonable manner.

Extremely passionate about this class, puts a lot of effort to get people interested and engaged. That said, her organization and presentation skills are lacking. Between her not understanding what class time should be used for and her taking forever to get to the point of what she's saying, you'll waste a lot of time in class.

I'd like to start by saying that the amount of time that this lab requires goes way beyond the 2 credits that you get for it; however, it is definitely a valuable experience.  Janet is always there to help you in your learning, but she really wants every person to work their problems out on their own. Overall, she's a great instructor!

Janet is one of the best instructors I have ever had. She is extremely kind and is always there for her students. Truly cares about her students, unlike many professors. Great person to get a letter of recommendation from.

I'm not going to lie, you have to put a lot of time and effort into lab. However, you will learn a TON in a very short amount of time and I loved having Janet in our lab! At times, Janet was a bit frustrating to talk with about project ideas because of her vagueness. But, she really just wants to help and is a great person!
Janet is like the mom of biocore. She is very understainding and knows how difficult b-core can be. That said, she can be very frustrating and unrealistic with her ideas.
She's helpful, if you ask and she'll answer your questions. Friendly, not bad.
Biocore 302 is tough, but Janet does her best to make it manageable.  She's sweet and very interested in her students' well-being.  Easy to talk to and understanad.

She wrote pages of instruction that could have been summed up in a few sentences then she would tell you to be concise.  She would refer to the Rubric for grading criterion, but the Rubric can be vague.  I find her to be quite frustrating.  Great ideas, horrible guidance.

Janet is awesome! So helpful and shes very approachable. Yes, the labs are hard (more so the papers than the actual labs) but they are definitely worth it. I feel like I had learned so much in such a short period of time.
Janet truly enjoys teaching her classes.  I was in her laboratory classes and while they were not the easiest classes, she did try to make the class enjoyable.

Biocore 302 is really a overwhelming experience, but Janet does her best to make it bearable. She's super nice and very helpful. Even though she has a PhD and may be one of the smartest people you will ever meet, she makes you feel like a human being and is very easy to talk with and tries to connect with you. Overall, you do get a lot of Biocore.
